intro: Crepis hastata, commonly known as the hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Crepis hastata is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
